overview_of_class:
This course introduces students to the current tools and technologies used for designing and developing interactive Web sites. Students will explore the basic design principles of page layout and navigation. Students will also learn how to develop Web pages using the Hypertext Markup Language (HTML5), describe page presentation using the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) language, and develop facility with useful Web development applications such as Adobe Dreamweaver.

The primary focus of this course will be on client-side technologies. At the end of the course, students will be familiar with the basic Web page components and structures. Special emphasis will be on understanding the Document Object Model (DOM) used in Web documents and used by the JavaScript language for creating interactive Web pages. Through the use of JavaScript, students will be introduced to programming concepts, event-driven programming, and entry-level object-orientation. Various other Web technologies such as DHTML, XML, XSLT, and Ajax will be also discussed.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Previous programming experience is recommended but not required

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1. Use HTML5 concepts and format to mark Web page components without resorting to Web authoring tools.
2. Use CSS concepts and format to describe Web page presentation without resorting to tools.
3. Use JavaScript programming techniques and the jQuery library to create interactive and dynamic Web pages.
4. Understand event handling concepts and use event handling techniques to create dynamic Web pages.
5. Understand the concepts of Document Object Model (DOM), XML, and Web services.
6. Develop facility with XML document format and validation
